text: owing. All courses listed may not be available each semester. Year One of Program You will need to consult and seek approval from your Program Manager prior to enrolling into any University Electives. Note that a maximum of Two (2) Courses can be chosen from the Approved University Postgraduate Elective list during the entire program. Complete the following Four (4) Courses:Course TitleCredit PointsCourse CodeCampusFashion Entrepreneurship12MKTG1310Brunswick CampusFibre to Fabric Essentials12GRAP2793Brunswick CampusFabric to Fashion Essentials12GRAP2792Brunswick CampusFabric to Fashion Innovation Studio12GRAP2794Brunswick Campus Fashion Entrepreneurship MKTG1310 Brunswick Campus Fibre to Fabric Essentials GRAP2793 Fabric to Fashion Essentials GRAP2792 Fabric to Fashion Innovation Studio GRAP2794 Semester Two BUSM4782 Marketing for Fashion Entrepreneurs MKTG1374 Fashion Business Finance Management BUSM4781 Fashion Forecasting and Analytics GRAP2388 Advanced Textile Materials and New Technologies MANU2154 Fashion Buying and Merchandise Management MKTG1290 E-Commerce for Fashion BUSM4366 Luxury Fashion Business Management BUSM4184 Digital Communication for Fashion GRAP2389 Fashion Retail Management Strategies MKTG1291 Fashion Brand Management MKTG1314 Global Fashion Enterprise BUSM4721 Global Fashion Supply Chains OMGT2192 Leadership and Management BUSM1530 City Campus BUSM2292 Hamilton Campus BUSM4480 Melbourne transfer to Vietnam Year Two of Program Complete the following Two (2) Core Courses:Course TitleCredit PointsCourse CodeCampusEthical and Sustainable Practices for Fashion and Textiles12GRAP2564Brunswick CampusInternational Entrepreneurship in Fashion and Textiles12GRAP2163Brunswick CampusANDSelect and Complete: Option 1: Two (2) of the following Courses OR Option 2: One (1) of the following Courses AND One (1) Course from the Approved University Postgrad Elective list to suit your area of professional interest.
